text: Hi kids!
Guess who's here..
Yes it's me bob..
Join me for learning street with me..
Let’s learn about pronouns while we eat, shall we ?
Are pronouns on the menu, Bob?
Ha ha no Johnny.
If you have a lot to say Pronouns are the way Instead of a noun You can use a pronoun.
Let me tell you just how You can use a pronoun. It, me, you and he We, they and she.

Ok, let me slow down Wipe off all your frowns take a pronoun at a time
And do it with a rhyme.

If you want to say polly has a sister called May You can use the word “SHE”
Now do you get me?
I think I do Bob.
I can say “She has a sister called May.”
Very good Mary.
You just used the word “I” that’s a pronoun. Tell me why?
Because I was used instead of Mary.
Yes!
To use words that are few She said “I think I do.” So I is a pronoun Used in place of a noun.
Now, let’s try singing some sentences first with Nouns only, and then by replacing the nouns with pronouns.
Ok Bob!

Polly loves Polly’s milkshake Polly loves HER milkshake So “HER” is a pronoun
Used in place of a noun.
The burger is big and tasty  “IT” is big and tasty So “IT” is a pronoun Used in place of a noun

Polly, Jack and Jill are having fun “WE” are all having funSo “WE” is a pronoun
Used in place of a noun.

Johnny says Johnny loves fries Johnny says “HE” loves fries So “HE” is a pronoun
Used in place of a noun
Do you love bob the Train? Do you love “ME” So “ME” is a pronoun Used in place of a noun.
We love you Bob!

I love Jack, Jill, Johnny, Mary, Polly.
I love “YOU” all too.So “YOU” is a pronoun
Used in place of nouns.

Jack is friends with Johnny Jack is friends with “HIM” So “HIM” is a pronoun
Used in place of a noun

The people are looking at kids and Bob.
“THEY” are looking at “US.” So “US” and “THEY”Are pronouns all the way.
So what are the pronouns we learnt today?
Us and they
him and her.
I and we, You and me.
He and she and it.
You kids are fast learners!.
Now lets see how fast you are at finishing your burgers.
Hahaha!
